required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Trial of Dexmedetomidine Hydrochloride Nasal Spray in Preoperative Sedation of Children
clinical_study.official_title: Study on Pharmacokinetics and Clinical Efficacy of Dexmedetomidine Hydrochloride Nasal Spray for Preoperative Sedation in Children

brief_summary.textblock: The study is being conducted to evaluate the efficacy, safety and the population pharmacokinetic characteristics of dexmedetomidine hydrochloride nasal spray for preoperative sedation in children

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Dexmedetomidine hydrochloride nasal spray compared with placebo
study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects who parent-child separation successful
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0 minute to 45 minutes after administration: every 15 minutes after administration
secondary_outcome.description: The FUNK scale is a scale of 1 to 4 for sedation, anxiety, and separation from parents. Separation success defined as a scale of 3 or 4 per item.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects who the Ramsay score is satisfactory at least once
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0 minute to 45 minutes after administration: every 5 minutes after administration
secondary_outcome.description: Sedation level using the Ramsay scale. Ramsay Satisfaction defined as a scale of 2, 3, or 4;

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects who the UMSS Scale is satisfactory at least once
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0 minute to 45 minutes after administration: every 5 minutes after administration
secondary_outcome.description: Sedation level using the University of Michigan Sedation Scale. UMSS satisfaction defined as a scale of 3, 4, 5, or 6;

secondary_outcome.measure: Total consumption of propofol(mg) during general anesthesia
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the beginning of anesthesia to the end of surgical operation up to 4 hours
secondary_outcome.description: Total consumption of propofol(mg) during general anesthesia

secondary_outcome.measure: Total consumption of opioid analgesic(μg) during general anesthesia
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the beginning of anesthesia to the end of surgical operation up to 4 hours
secondary_outcome.description: Total consumption of opioid analgesic(μg) during general anesthesia

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 4 hours after the end of surgical operation

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects with postoperative agitation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 4 hours after the end of surgical operation
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of subjects with postoperative agitation

intervention.description: In the low weight group, 18 subjects will receive a low dose of dexmedetomidine nasal spray. In the high weight group, 18 subjects will receive a high dose of dexmedetomidine nasal spray.

intervention.intervention_name: Dexmedetomidine hydrochloride nasal spray blank preparation.
intervention.description: In the low weight group, 6 subjects will receive dexmedetomidine hydrochloride nasal spray blank preparation. In the high weight group, 6 subjects will receive dexmedetomidine hydrochloride nasal spray blank preparation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Able and willing to provide a written informed consent
2. Male or female
3. Subjects requiring elective general anesthesia surgery
4. Conform to the ASA Physical Status Classification
5. Meet the weight standard
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Not suitable for nasal spray
2. Pediatric populations requiring special care or court/social welfare supervision
3. Subjects who had been under general anesthesia were randomized
4. Subjects with mental disorders and cognitive impairment；Subject with a history of epilepsy
5. Subjects with previous abnormal behavior after medication
6. Subjects with cardiovascular disease
7. Clinically significant abnormal clinical laboratory test value
8. Subjects whose hemoglobin is below the lower limit of normal
9. Subjects who have either an adrenergic receptor agonist or an antagonist were randomized
10. Participated in clinical trials of other drugs before screening (accepted experimental drugs)
11. A history or possibility of difficult airway
12. History of hypersensitivity to drug ingredients or components
13. Other circumstances that the investigator judged inappropriate for participation in this clinical trial

facility.name: Beijing children's hospital, capital medical university
